title: Understanding $$f{\left(\frac{x}{h}\right)}$$
text: For some value $$h$$ not equal to $$0$$, $$f{\left(\frac{x}{h}\right)}$$ means that f(x) is stretched horizontally by $$h$$. Similarly, $$f{\left(h x\right)}$$ means that f(x) is compressed horizontally by $$h$$.

title: Understanding $$f{\left(\frac{x}{h}\right)}$$
text: Since $$h$$ is $$\frac{1}{2}$$, $$f{\left(\frac{x}{2}\right)}$$ means that the graph is stretched horizontally by $$2$$.
